intro: Caconapea beccabunga, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is found in temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb that thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Caconapea beccabunga is often used in rock gardens due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
